intro: Pycnocycla aucheriana var. mesomorpha, commonly known as the dwarf cycad, is a rare and ancient plant species native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing stature and a stout, unbranched trunk that is often covered in a thick, fibrous sheath. The plant produces large, palm-like leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in a rosette pattern around the trunk. Its reproductive structures include a single, cone-like structure that develops at the base of the plant, containing both male and female reproductive organs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
